Aha! I knew it!! Language is what makes us humans (domesticated primates) different from all the rest of the critters on this planet, and it looks like these guys are starting to show that our individual language patterns are crucial in defining our culture and attitudes. Okay, maybe they don't go quite that far, but it is a cool study that makes you wonder what language to learn next. Actually I remember listening to a talk a long time ago and far far away, and the speaker showed PET brain scans of a brain reading western linear script (alphanumeric stuff like you are reading now). Certain predictable and not predictable parts of the brain began to light up. Then, he showed the same person reading Mandarin Chinese with its somewhat non-linear ideograms, and the same portions lit up as before, but with many more places lit up as well. I am no expert on this, obviously, but the idea is quite intriguing. urlLink Link to New Scientist article. Image courtesy urlLink manipulator.com .
